title: How can I stop a wage garnishment that already started without going the BK way?
question: I recently received a wage garnishment from my employer. They already have started the garnishment and are taking 25% which is the max CA allows too. This has hurt me financially and now I am taking home 1600 a month or even less. That's less than $400 a week. I need help with matter.
answers: Try to reach an agreement with the creditor, but at this time you are at their mercy. Contact an attorney.

When you were served with the wage garnishment, the paperwork included instructions on how to file for a claim of exemption. If you did not notice that or did not understand what it meant or how to make the claim, you can still do it but you will probably need a lawyer to handle it.

Find/consult/hire a lawyer in your area using the Avvo feature "Find a Lawyer". Make a list of 4-5 having many 5 star reviews from satisfied clients. If you don't get a prompt call back from one, go on to the next on your list. Some offer a free consultation by phone or in person. Take us up on it.
File bankruptcy or quit your job. There is no other way once a garnishment has started.
